Dialogue.NPCText:
You are enveloped in a fragrant swirl of jasmine and silk. Before you stands Tomo, swathed in resplendent kimono patterned with iridescent beetles. Her eyes glimmer—restless as dragonflies on a pond.

“Ah, another wanderer upon the loom of fate! Does your thread seek color, or purpose? Every robe is a story, every dye a drop of dusk or dawn. What brings you to my humble cocoon?”

Option.text: I seek new attire—something woven with magic.
You speak strangely. What do your metaphors mean?
What’s with all the beetle dyes?
Rumor says your silks ward against darkness.
Who are you, truly, behind all the silks and riddles?
I’m just browsing.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Tomo’s fingers flutter like moths. “To don my silks is to vanish amid moonlit reeds. My threads are plucked from the secret heart of jungle beetles—each dye a spell in disguise.

Would you be a crane in the mist, unseen? Or a blossom dazzling in the festival sun?”

Option.text: I wish for stealth—make me as the hidden moon.
I want to stand out—a robe to turn all eyes!
I am neither crane nor blossom. What else?
I cannot decide yet.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Tomo smiles slyly, eyes glinting. “A river stone stirs not the current, but turns aside the shadow. I can weave you the Night-Heron’s Mantle, but beetle dyes are rare as honest politicians.

Bring me three Midnight Beetle Carapaces from the jungle, and I will shroud you in shadow. Return empty-handed, and you remain a fish out of water.”

Option.text: Where do I find Midnight Beetles?
I have the carapaces.
Not yet, but I will return.

Dialogue.NPCText: Tomo’s hands tremble with anticipation. “Let me see… yes! The moon’s armor, glossy as secrets. Stay while I spin silence into cloth.”

Option.text: (Wait patiently.)

Dialogue.NPCText:
With a flourish, Tomo presents a cloak that seems to drink the light.
“Wear this, and you are the breath between heartbeats. Shadows become your kin.”

(You receive the Night-Heron’s Mantle. Stealth skill increased when worn.)

Option.text: Thank you, Tomo.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Ah! To outshine the spring peony, one must brave the sting of the jungle. I will craft you the Festival Kimono of Many Dyes—but you must bring me three Jewel-Beetle Wings.
Only the bold gather such radiance. Will you seize the rainbow or fade into plainness?”

Option.text: Where do I find Jewel-Beetles?
I have the wings.
I’ll return with the wings.

Dialogue.NPCText: Tomo clasps the wings, awed. “Prisms caught in amber! Wait, as I summon the spirit of festival days.”

Option.text: (Wait and watch her work.)

Dialogue.NPCText:
Tomo drapes a breathtaking kimono upon you, its colors shifting with every breath.
“Now, walk as a rainbow at dusk. All eyes will follow.”

(You receive the Festival Kimono of Many Dyes. Unlocks new cosmetic dye options.)

Option.text: I am dazzling! Thank you.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Not all wish to be seen, nor to vanish—some wish to endure. For them I weave the Wardweave Undergarment: silk spun with secret sigils, to turn aside the night’s poison.
Bring me one Moon-Marked Cocoon and I will weave you armor against Minax’s whispers.”

Option.text: Where do I find a Moon-Marked Cocoon?
I have the cocoon.
I will return when I have it.

Dialogue.NPCText: Tomo’s eyes fill with reverence. “The moon’s promise, strong yet yielding. With this, I spin ward against the world’s venom.”

Option.text: (Wait reverently.)

Dialogue.NPCText:
Tomo hands you a soft, faintly glowing under-robe.
“Wear it beneath your armor, and Minax’s darkness shall slip past you like wind through bamboo.”

(You receive the Wardweave Undergarment. Grants resistance to curses.)

Option.text: May your loom never tangle, Tomo.

Dialogue.NPCText: Tomo tilts her head, amused. “Words are threads; stories are the tapestry. What is a day, if not a pattern woven of shadow and light? In metaphor, we find truth hidden from Minax’s spies.”

Option.text: Do you ever speak plainly?
Your riddles have a beauty to them.
I seek your wares, not your wisdom.

Dialogue.NPCText: She laughs softly. “To speak plain is to wear rough cloth. My tongue is silk—take it as it is, or not at all!”

Option.text: Very well. Show me your finest silks.
I must go.

Dialogue.NPCText: Tomo bows, pleased. “Even the crane admires its own reflection. If you have an ear for riddles, perhaps you can hear the whispers woven in my cloth.”

Option.text: Show me your silks.
I should be on my way.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Beetles bear the color of dusk, the armor of kings. Each dye is a secret stolen from the heart of the jungle—dangerous to catch, but worth every sting. Minax cannot corrupt what is wild and iridescent.”

Option.text: Can I help collect beetles?
Perhaps another time.

Dialogue.NPCText: “If you bring me beetle carapaces or wings, I will trade you secrets, silks, or coin. Beetles thrive near moonlit pools, but beware: the jungle is woven with Minax’s traps.”

Option.text: I will return with beetle parts.

Dialogue.NPCText: Tomo draws a sigil in the air. “My warded silks are cocoon and chrysalis both. Those who wear them are not easily snared by Minax’s curses. But beware: even silk may tear, if the fate-weaver tugs too hard.”

Option.text: How can I earn a warded silk?
I’m interested in stealth or festival attire instead.
I will be cautious. Farewell.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Midnight Beetles and Jewel-Beetles haunt the shadowed jungle east of Hinokami, lured by moonlight and rotting bamboo. But beware: where beetles feast, Minax’s venomous spiders often lurk.”

Option.text: Thank you, Tomo. I will hunt wisely.

Dialogue.NPCText: “The Moon-Marked Cocoon is spun by a rare lunar moth, high in the bamboo thickets. It glows faintly under full moons, but poachers sell fakes. Trust only those with hands unstained by greed.”

Option.text: Thank you, Tomo. I’ll seek it out.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Then wander as the leaf, but remember: every thread finds its place in the end.”

Option.text: Perhaps I’ll return for silk and riddles.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Tomo clasps her hands behind her back, gazing out over the rooftops.

“Once, I was but a plain thread—child of farmers beneath Tokuno’s storm-kissed skies. But the wind tore my homeland apart, and Minax scattered my family like petals in a storm.
I fled with nothing but a beetle-wing clasp and the memory of my mother’s loom.

Here, in this alien soil, I weave myself anew. Silk is memory. Color is hope. And riddles... are armor.”

Option.text: Your metaphors shield grief, don’t they?
You’ve suffered much. I’m sorry.
Sounds like you're just hiding behind fancy words.
I understand the need to start again.

Dialogue.NPCText: Tomo nods slowly. “Aye. Truth cuts cleaner than steel, but rarely heals. I weave riddles to stitch the soul... and perhaps to avoid unraveling entirely.”

Option.text: Then tell me a truth, not a riddle.
I’ll respect your silences, then.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She smiles faintly. “A kind word is worth ten yards of thread. But don’t pity me—I survived, and surviving is a sort of art.”

She reaches into a lacquered box and offers a delicate charm.

Option.text: (Accept the silk charm.)

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Thread from my first loom. A token of a weaver's gratitude. May it catch luck and turn it your way.”

(This charm may one day be useful...)

Option.text: Thank you, Tomo. I’ll treasure it.

Dialogue.NPCText: Tomo’s eyes narrow. “Even a worm turns when prodded. Be careful—mocking a weaver may unravel the very thread you walk upon.”

Option.text: Tch. You’re as dramatic as your silks.
I meant no offense. Truly.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She exhales, some tension leaving her shoulders.
“Words can be re-woven, if the speaker has needle and grace. Let us begin again—with silk, not swords.”

Option.text: Agreed. Tell me of your craft.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Her expression softens. “Then we are both stitches in the same tapestry. Perhaps I judged you too quickly.”

She produces a folded scroll from her sleeve.

Option.text: What’s this?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“A recipe. One I brought from Tokuno before the sky burned. It teaches how to treat beetle silk with ash-powder—makes it near invisible in fog.”
(You learn a stealth-enhancing dye recipe!)

Option.text: Thank you for sharing something sacred.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Tomo whispers, “I once served a lesser mage under Minax. Before I fled. I still hear his chants in my dreams…

That is why I hate the dark, why I weave against it. Every thread I twist is defiance.”
She looks up, brave and brittle.

Option.text: You fight her in your own way.
That’s why your silks resist curses?

Dialogue.NPCText: She inclines her head. “We all fight. Swords or silks—it’s the will that matters.”

Option.text: Then I’ll help you gather beetle dyes.
